meanings.definition: The adverse side effects or results of a situation or event.
meanings.sent1: The fallout from the argument was a strained relationship.
meanings.sent2: The fallout from the failed project was a loss of trust.
meanings.sent3: The fallout from the prank was a lot of laughter.
meanings.sent4: The fallout from the decision was a wave of consequences.
meanings.sent5: The fallout from the storm was a mess to clean up.

meanings.definition: Radioactive particles that are carried by the wind after a nuclear explosion.
meanings.sent1: The fallout from the explosion spread radiation far and wide.
meanings.sent2: The fallout from the nuclear test contaminated the area.
meanings.sent3: The fallout from the reactor leak caused concern among the residents.
meanings.sent4: The fallout from the bomb created a hazardous zone.
meanings.sent5: The fallout from the blast was dangerous to be near.

meanings.definition: The settling of airborne particles after an explosion or fire.
meanings.sent1: The fallout from the fire covered everything in ash.
meanings.sent2: The fallout from the explosion left a layer of debris.
meanings.sent3: The fallout from the fireworks display was a colorful sky.
meanings.sent4: The fallout from the volcano eruption coated the landscape.
meanings.sent5: The fallout from the demolition settled slowly.
